div.l: Oure corn wasyswasys stolen sothly it is no nay
And we han had an ill fit to day
And syn I schall haue noon amendement
A gayn my losse I woll haue esement
By goddis saule it schall nan other be
This Iohn answerd Aleyn a vise the
The Miller is a ꝑperilous man he seide
And if that he out of his slape a breide
He myght don vs bothe a vilanye
Aleyn answerd I counte hym nought a flye
And vp he rist ⁊and bi the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vp right ⁊and faste slepte
Till he so nye was or sche myght spye
That it had ben to late for to crye
And schortly for to seyn thei were at on
Now play Aleyn for I woll speke of Iohn
¶ This Iohn lieth stille a forlong weie or two
And to hym self he maketh routhe ⁊and wo
Allas ꝙquod he this is a wikke iape
Now may I seyn that I is but an ape
Yet hath my felawe som what for his harm
He hath the Millers doughter in his arm
He auntrid hym ⁊and hath his nedes spedde
And I lye as a draf sacche in my bedde
And whan this iape is tolde a nother day
I schall be holde a daffe a cokenay
I woll a rise ⁊and aunter it be my faith
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men saith
And vp he roos ⁊and softly he went
Vn to the cradell ⁊and in his honde it hent
And bare it softe vn to his beddis fete
Sone aftir the wif hir routyng lete
And gan to wake ⁊and went hir out to pisse
And com a gayn ⁊and gan hir cradell mysse
And gropid here ⁊and there but sche sche fonde non
Allas ꝙquod sche I had almost mys gon
I had almost gon to the clerkis bedde
Ey benedicite than had I foule spedde
And forth sche goth till sche the cradill fonde
Sche gropeth alwaie forther with hir honde
And fonde the bed ⁊and thought nought but good
By cause that the cradell bi it stood
And nyst wher͗e sche was for it was derk
But fair ⁊and well sche crepe in to the clerk
And lieth full stille ⁊and wolde haue caught a slepe
With yn a while this Iohn the clerk vp lepe
And on this gode wif he leieth on sore
